name: Titanium.UI.Android.SearchView
summary: A specialized text field for entering search text.

events.name: focus
events.summary: Fired when the search view gains focus.
events.description: This event only fires when using the trackball to navigate.

events.name: blur
events.summary: Fired when the search view loses focus.

events.name: cancel
events.summary: Fired when the cancel button is pressed.
events.description: Due to the current Android Issue, this event does not work with Android 4.0+. Alternatively, when using SearchView in the action bar, you can listen for the collapse event.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired when the value of the search view changes.

events.name: submit
events.summary: If the search query is not empty, fired when the search button is clicked on soft keyboard

methods.name: blur
methods.summary: Causes the search view to lose focus.

methods.name: focus
methods.summary: Causes the search view to gain focus.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Color of the text in this SearchView, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: hintText
properties.summary: Text to show when the search view field is not focused.

properties.name: hintTextColor
properties.summary: Color of hint text that displays when field is empty.
properties.description: Color of hint text that displays when field is empty.
properties.default: Default Android theme's hint text color.

properties.name: iconifiedByDefault
properties.summary: Sets the default or resting state of the search view

properties.name: submitEnabled
properties.summary: Whether to display the submit button when necessary or never display.

properties.name: value
properties.description: This value cannot be set until after the search view is created.
